competitors.name: SentinelOne Singularity
competitors.notes: Strong replacement with similar EDR performance at lower pricing. 10% market share. Stock rose 10% after July 2024 CrowdStrike outage.

competitors.name: Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
competitors.notes: Strong choice for Microsoft-invested businesses. Part of Microsoft 365 E5 package. 11.82% market share.

competitors.name: Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR
competitors.notes: One of world's best detection and response providers. Stock rose 10% after July 2024 CrowdStrike outage.

competitors.name: McAfee ePO
competitors.notes: Leading competitor with 15.73% market share in endpoint protection.

competitors.name: Sophos
competitors.notes: Focuses on mid-sized organizations. Strong position in SMB market.

competitors.name: Trend Micro Vision One
competitors.notes: Unified security platform for all business sizes.

competitors.name: Trellix
competitors.notes: Endpoint security competitor (merger of McAfee Enterprise and FireEye).

competitors.name: VMware Carbon Black Endpoint
competitors.notes: Cloud-native endpoint protection with EDR capabilities.

key_events.july_2024_outage: Global IT outage on July 19, 2024 affected 8.5M+ Windows devices. Estimated $10B in worldwide financial damage.

context: CrowdStrike maintains 21.21% market share as leader in endpoint protection. The July 2024 global outage significantly impacted CrowdStrike's reputation, benefiting competitors like SentinelOne and Palo Alto Networks. Market is transitioning from EDR to XDR.
